fields.profile:
Saket Modi is a London-based financial trainer and consultant. He has designed and facilitated workshops for finance professionals from over 50 countries in North America, Europe, Middle East, Africa and Asia.

Saket specialises in financial reporting and analysis (IFRS/IPSAS), including financial instruments and insurance contracts. He has spent considerable time working, advising and training in matters relating to IFRS, and delivered workshops for corporate, banks and similar financial institutions, public sector organisations, and professional services firms. Saket has facilitated courses on ESG reporting and IFRS impact of climate change for organisations globally.

Accomplished supply chain professional with an expertise in the area of procurement, supply management, cost analysis, commodity forecasting and supplier development, and author of “The Sustainable Business” and both 101 & 102 “Models of Procurement & Supply Chain Management”.
Paul consistently delivers commercial strategic benefits across a range of private and public sector markets and has positively influenced large blue-chip organisations such as BAE Systems, Chevron, Coca Cola, JP Morgan and Telia. 
Paul is an experienced business manager who approaches all aspects of his work with a heavy focus on the improvement of profit through cost reduction, development of markets in locations such as Nigeria and China, and through the improvement of skills in the workforce.

Governance, culture and risk management consultant, expert witness, trainer and author.
Paul is an acknowledged expert in corporate governance and risk management and for 13 years led ACCA's (the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants) global thought leadership on these subjects. He now works with boards and executive teams in assessing
and improving their culture and governance and risk management practices to improve organisational performance and resilience. He also writes and trains boards and others on governance, board effectiveness, risk, business ethics and corporate culture and is currently writing a text book on corporate governance.

Paul is visiting professor of Corporate Governance at London South Bank University, co-chairman of the CRSA Forum, a network of practitioners established in 1994 interested in the behavioural and cultural aspects of risk, governance and organisational performance.

Grant is an internationally recognised risk & governance professional and non-executive director who has held senior leadership roles with private and public sector organisations in the energy, engineering & construction, banking and finance sectors where he has led strategy, risk,  regulation & policy, mergers, acquisitions & business integration, and business transformation programmes for some of the world’s leading organisations during a career spanning 25+ years.

His senior executive and board positions include roles in global businesses including ALSTOM, Caminus, IBM, Siemens and Wipro working with global major energy firms in addition to holding advisory and board positions in small cap firms in the energy and finance sectors.

fields.qualification: Adjunct Professor, MBA, FCIPD, FinstAM, MRSH, MAPS, MBPS, FILM
fields.profile:
Dr.Tony Miller has spent most of his international career in business consulting, training and development, working in public and private sectors.
His first degree is in engineering, after changing careers his second degree Masters and Doctorate are in Psychology.
His experience as an International management performance consultant has enabled him to work at strategic level with Government, national committees, Financial Regulators, on EU projects and with blue chip companies worldwide. He has appeared on television and in a number of documentaries, and directed the EU video “Model for European Business Success”. He is the author
of numerous published articles in professional journals and joint author of a number of professional psychology reports on achieving productivity improvements in organisations. He featured regularly in publications as “expert opinion” specialising in improving performance through people.

fields.title: Risk Management:	Contractor Evaluation in the Oil Industry
fields.overview: The course provides participants with a comprehensive understanding of risk assessment and management practices specific to contractor selection and management within the oil industry.
fields.audience:
Professionals and stakeholders involved in risk management within the oil industry. This includes 
Risk managers, Project managers, Safety officers, Procurement managers, Contract managers.
fields.learning_outcome: Understanding the principles and importance of risk management in the context of contractor evaluation within the oil industry. Developing skills in assessing and identifying potential risks associated with contractor selection and management processes. Learning methods and tools for evaluating contractor capabilities, performance history, and compliance with industry regulations and standards.
fields.key_questions:
What are the primary risks associated with contractor selection and management in the oil industry?
How can we assess and prioritise risks related to contractor capabilities, performance, and compliance? What criteria should be considered when evaluating contractors for oil industry projects? What tools and methodologies are available for conducting comprehensive risk assessments of contractors?
How can we effectively mitigate and manage risks throughout the contractor lifecycle?

fields.title: Advanced IFRS Principles and Application Challenges
fields.overview: International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) has become a global accounting language. There are currently over 165 countries that require or permit the use of IFRS for listed companies. The correct adoption of IFRS promises organisations in all the sectors many benefits including greater consistency, comparability and transparency of financial reporting resulting in enhanced investor confidence across the globe. Research has proved that adoption of IFRS reduces the cost of capital and cost
fields.audience:
The workshop will be useful for staff in finance department, Internal and external auditors
Regulators, Financial and credit analysts who review financial statements and sustainability reports
fields.learning_outcome:
By end of the workshop, the participants will:
Obtain an in-depth understanding of the principles in key IFRSs as applicable to corporates and financial institutions
Evaluate the impact on financial statements of the application of IFRSs, including recent changes to existing standards
Analyse the impact of rising interest rates and inflation on IFRS financial statements
Learn the essentials of ESG reporting requirements in IFRS sustainability reporting standards
fields.key_questions:
Non-current Assets
Provisions, contingent liabilities and contingent assets (IAS 37)
Revenue from contracts with customers (IFRS 15)
Lease Accounting

fields.title: The Contribution of the Corporate Secretary to the Progressive Development of the Board
fields.overview: Refresher/summary of what we covered in October on risk including introduction to risk assessment and risk management, the role of the board in relation to risk, our identification of strengths and concerns, our responses to the session.
fields.audience:
Corporate Secretary
Board members 
Compliance Officer
fields.learning_outcome:
To obtain a detailed knowledge and practical understanding of:
the dynamic role of the Corporate Secretary in the context of corporate governance 
the strategic role of Corporate Secretaries in the Boardroom
Company Secretaries' core duties and responsibilities
how to manage director conflicts of interest 
how to manage the relationships between Corporate Secretaries and Chairmen and CEOs 
board, committee and director evaluation
the statutory duties for corporate record keeping.
fields.key_questions:
Roles and responsibilities of the Corporate Secretary 
Assistance to the Board
The essentials of corporate governance 
Strategy for the Corporate Secretary
Constitution and regulation of companies
Statutory Record keeping and filing 
Accounting, annual reporting and auditing
What the company secretary needs to know about risk, risk management and internal control
Use of IT: open discussion

fields.title: Risk Governance for Boards and Executives
fields.overview: This programme is designed for current and future executive and non-executive (independent) Board Members and for senior executives. It will equip them to effectively discharge their individual and collective risk governance roles, responsibilities and accountabilities, and lead the organisation to success and sustainability through risk governance excellence. Invaluable and insightful for board members, board committee members and senior (C Suite) executives.

fields.title: The immediate impact of Artificial Intelligence on Human Resources and the world of work
fields.overview: Artificial Intelligence will change the world as we know it within only a few years. Its most significant impact will be on our Human Resource.  What is A.I. and what's made it significant? This seminar has a wide appeal but is not designed for IT experts. The event will provide for many organisations the catalyst for swift change to take strategic advantage of what A.I. has to offer.
fields.audience:
Anyone who is in a management position. Those responsible for Organisational design, productivity, Workforce Planning. Those who manage processes of are responsible for profitability.
The program is particularly well suited for HR directors and for those who need to know what the next two years have in store for the Human resource.
fields.learning_outcome: Participants will understand AI and its applications in HR, explore benefits and challenges, identify AI tools for HR tasks, learn AI-driven analytics for decision-making, recognise ethical implications, develop implementation strategies, study successful AI HR case studies, enhance skills in AI technology evaluation, understand future trends of AI in HR, and engage in peer discussions and knowledge-sharing.
fields.key_questions:
What is artificial intelligence and what is its impact going to be? 
Human resources – on the front line for a change
How artificial intelligence and process redesign will impact on organisational structures and reducing headcount – right-sizing your organisation
Aligning HR processes with AI – productivity measurement and performance appraisal

fields.comment: The training provided by Bizeducate was invaluable. It equipped me with the necessary skills to lead my team more effectively. Highly recommend!
I was pleasantly surprised by the depth and relevance of the training content. It exceeded my expectations and has already made a positive impact on my approach to strategic planning.
The trainers at Bizeducate are experts in their field. Their practical insights and real-world examples added immense value to the training sessions. I look forward to applying what I've learned.
The training sessions were engaging and interactive. I appreciated the opportunity to collaborate with peers from other companies and gain new perspectives.

As a senior manager, I've attended many training programs, but Bizeducate stands out for its customised approach and personalised attention. The trainers took the time to understand our specific challenges and tailored the content accordingly.
The training materials were comprehensive and well-organised. I found the practical exercises particularly helpful in reinforcing key concepts. Thank you for a job well done!
Bizeducate's training programs are top-notch. The trainers are not only knowledgeable but also passionate about their subject matter, which made the learning experience enjoyable and inspiring.
